intro: Phacelia leptostachya, commonly known as slender-stemmed phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Phacelia leptostachya is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
